intro: Haplophyllum reuteri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers bright, indirect light. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and bloom throughout the year under optimal conditions. Haplophyllum reuteri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
